conclusion: Consider the area under the acceleration-time graph to determine change in velocity.
Acceleration of Object A is constant, represented by a horizontal line.
Change in velocity for Object A is a rectangle with area \( a_A \cdot t_1 \).
Acceleration of Object B increases linearly with time.
Change in velocity for Object B is a triangle with area \( a_A \cdot t_1 \).
Both objects have the same change in velocity from \( t = 0 \) to \( t_1 \).
At time \( t_1 \), Objects A and B have the same velocity.
